Overwatch 1 players were in a drought for 4 years for content and the Overwatch 2 launch is all they had to show for it. It's basically nothing, and there are a lot of aspects worse than the original. Including a horrible monetization model.

In addition, there isn't a proper PvE either, which was a huge lie on behalf of blizzard. The whole reason for a 2. It can also be speculated that blizzard knew they were cancelling the PvE campaign and concealed announcing it to their player-base until they absolutely had to.

I donâ€™t know why they decided to launch ow2 on steam, besides money. Which seems to be the only thing driving this cash-grab. Blizzard redefined a sequel in the worst way possible. Absolutely a downgrade.

10$ battle pass which rewards "credits" which cant be used on the next battle pass and can only be used on old overwatch 1 skins. the free battle pass tiers gives you 1500 credits and the paid tiers give you an additional 500, 2000 credits is worth 2 base legendary skins (1000c) or 1 event legendary skin (1500c). 
also the skins we can buy with credits are slowly and quietly being removed and turned into twitch drops for watching 6-9 hours of overwatch live streams (conductor reinhardt, cabana ana, funky baptiste, mystery man mcree, socialite ashe, and sukajan kiriko which may be obtainable without twitch but i already have it through twitch so i dont know) 

free players can look forward to 60 free overwatch coins (worth 60 cents) by completing 12 of 13 weekly challenges such as completing 15-30 matches, completing 10-20 matches as all roles (hope you like playing tank), earn 8 progression levels (new system this season where each hero has their own unique level based on how often and how well you play them), complete 23-45 unranked matches, complete 15-30 ranked matches, complete 8-15 arcade matches, complete 8-15 matches playing as 1 role and then doing that again for another role, and the rest are just stat related challenges (get x amount of damage, x amount of healing, etc.)
the best possible scenario is if you only play all role in unranked, win 23 unranked matches, win 15 ranked matches, win 8 arcade matches, make sure that 16 out of the 46 matches youve won in a row were as 2 different roles, do extremely well in all 46 matches to level up 8 times and to deal 100,000 damage, block 32,000 damage, deal 52,000 healing, earn 250 assists or saves, and get 50 kills or assists with ultimates. all for 60 cents. and these challenges reset every tuesday

12-30$ hero specific cosmetic bundles in the item shop in a game with 38 heroes

new meta heroes locked behind challenges and paywalls (battle passes and item shop bundles)

entire game announced as story heavy pve overwatch game, story mode and hero talent tree system gets cancelled, reduced to 15$ item shop bundle of 3 missions that you can play for some sprays and voice lines, and the games lore is portrayed through a computer with some emails, chat logs, and voicemails. 
cant trust something that costs 15$ to actually be worth the 15$ with blizzard

a lot of things were removed during the move from overwatch 1 to overwatch 2, like the old card system for endorsing players, the on fire system (added back in 8 months later), normal account level progression, loot boxes and all kinds of free rewards besides occasional event challenges and competitive points to unlock gold guns, the entire assault game mode, and map pools were added (and removed 4 months later) which removed maps for seasons 

a new season comes out, you buy the battle pass to try the new character and because surely overwatch is back and youll play it for real this time, the game becomes very stale after about a week, you stop playing for 2 months, you reopen the game and grind challenges only because the battle pass ends in 12 days and you want the money to go to something at least, and it all happens again when the next season comes out

a little irrelevant now but wanted to bring up when the game first came out there was a bug that caused people to unknowingly be buying cosmetics in the background while playing the game and blizzard denied all of these people their money back

Okay an actual review from a steam enjoyer
i get tf2 fans hate on this game and honestly blizzard isnt really known for being the best but as a tf2 fan i really enjoy this game.  really sucks how much is payed now but honestly if you are a tf2 fan you really dont have much to complain money for 25 bucks you can open a crate in hopes you get something that will make it worth it. sadly most modern games are monetized heavily and i use bing to get my own coins so dont spend much but the core game is very much free its just if you want silly skins or pve (much like tf2)
but even if it takes awhile to get used to the 5v5 based style its refreshing and something i enjoy learning and playing
all the heros are fun to play except road hog imo but you have variety and each team comp makes it refreshing. much are comparing to tf2 but i feel like they shouldn't be compared. tf2 is way more casual, silly and just a nice game to relax in. overwatch can be the same but there is more ppl wanting to play the objective and just in general more competitive and that aspect
but its a game i enjoy and learning tech in. and i hope ppl stop review bombing and actually give it a chance. fair if you dont like after playing but not putting energy to play and just leave a negative review because it surpassed a game we love isnt fair to either. you can enjoy a game without putting down another

- add battle pass and lock new heroes behind it
- lie about pve
- change 6v6 to 5v5
- add new map

Yes, let's call it Overwatch 2...
